intro: Ruellia longipes, commonly known as the long-stemmed ruellia, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of the Americas. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its upright growth habit and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically features opposite, lance-shaped leaves and produces blue or purple flowers that attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Ruellia longipes is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and vibrant blooms. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and prefers partial to full sunlight.
